intro: Helosciadium intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate hedge woundwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a creeping rootstock and can form dense mats, which helps in soil stabilization. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
